articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Dominant 7th in B (Shape: E)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Dominant 7th in B (Shape: E) 

## Brief Presentation
The Dominant 7th arpeggio in B with the shape of E is a set of notes that include the root (B), major third (D#), perfect fifth (F#), and minor seventh (A) of the B dominant 7th chord. It is a versatile and commonly used arpeggio in various musical genres.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (root)
- D# (major third)
- F# (perfect fifth)
- A (minor seventh)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This particular arpeggio is often used in jazz, blues, funk, and rock music genres. It adds tension and a bluesy flavor to the sound, making it ideal for creating dynamic solos and melodic lines.

## Songs
Here are three songs that prominently feature the Dominant 7th arpeggio in B (Shape: E):
1. "The Thrill is Gone" by B.B. King
2. "Red House" by Jimi Hendrix
3. "Cissy Strut" by The Meters
